intro: Bactris villosa, commonly known as the hairy palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its robust trunk and pinnate leaves, which are often covered in fine, hairy structures. Bactris villosa typically grows in lowland areas and is adapted to humid, well-drained soils. It produces edible fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife and some human populations.
